headline: Coca-Cola reports jump in packaging deemed recyclable
summary: The beverage giant’s metrics for recycled plastic ratios and overall virgin plastic volumes both rose in 2024.

headline: How Coca-Cola's 63rd Straight Dividend Hike (KO) Shapes Its Long-Term Investment Narrative
summary: Earlier this year, Coca-Cola raised its quarterly dividend for the 63rd consecutive year, reaffirming its position as a Dividend King and highlighting consistent shareholder rewards. This track record underscores the company's resilience, supported by a diversified beverage portfolio and renewed growth in key away-from-home consumption channels. We’ll explore how Coca-Cola’s enduring dividend strength may further influence its long-term investment case amid market shifts. AI is about to...

headline: Some PepsiCo investors are still cautious about Elliott's plan to spin out bottling
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Some investors in PepsiCo support suggestions by activist shareholder Elliott Investment Management that the global food and beverage company cut costs and ditch sleepy brands like Quaker, but sound more cautious about the hedge fund's boldest idea - to hive off the soda maker's bottling network.  Elliott has said the move, which mirrors actions taken by Coca-Cola nearly a decade ago, would increase PepsiCo's margins, allow the $200 billion company to focus on new chips and sodas and turn it into a simpler, more-focused organization.  Earlier this month, Elliott unveiled a $4 billion stake in PepsiCo - one of its largest investments- and released a 75-page report with ideas on how to boost profit at the company, whose share price has tumbled nearly 20% in the last year, underperforming a 2% fall in the broader S&P consumer staples index.

headline: 2 Reasons to Like KO (and 1 Not So Much)
summary: Coca-Cola currently trades at $66.25 per share and has shown little upside over the past six months, posting a small loss of 3.9%. The stock also fell short of the S&P 500’s 16.2% gain during that period.
